item.title: RealClearPolitics - Palin's Secret Weapon: New Film to Premiere in June
item.description: IS SHE RUNNING?PALIN 'SECRET WEAPON' FILM SET FOR JUNE RELEASE http://goo.gl/tBA2W
item.content:encoded: IS SHE RUNNING?PALIN 'SECRET WEAPON' FILM SET FOR JUNE RELEASE http://goo.gl/tBA2W Shortly after Republicans swept last November to a historic victory in which Sarah Palin was credited with playing a central role, the former Alaska governor pulled aside her close aide, Rebecca Mansour, to discuss a hush-hush assignment: Reach out to conservative filmmaker Stephen K. Bannon with a request. Ask him if he would make a series of videos extolling Palin's governorship and laying to rest lingering questions about her controversial decision to resign from office with a year-and-a-half left in her first term. It was this abdication, Palin knew, that had made her damaged goods in the eyes of some Republicans who once were eager to get behind her potential 2012 presidential Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: realclearpolitics.com

item.title: Members of Congress Get Abnormally High Returns From Their Stocks
item.description: Anyone surprised by this? New academic study shows members of Congress get abnormally high returns from their stocks http://huff.to/jHZPRL
item.content:encoded: Anyone surprised by this? New academic study shows members of Congress get abnormally high returns from their stocks http://huff.to/jHZPRL Members of the House of Representatives considerably outperform the stock market in their personal investments, according to a new academic study. Four university researchers examined 16,000 common stock transactions made by approximately 300 House representatives from 1985 to 2001, and found what they call "significant positive abnormal returns," with portfolios based on congressional trades beating the market by about 6 percent annually. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

The San Francisco-based online gaming company's valuation in its last round of funding was $10 billion, but it is likely to price itself higher in an offering, given the recent series of strong IPOs for Internet companies. item.title: Kohort Is Group Management Done Simple, Yet Robust
item.description: Kohort Is Group Management Done Simple, Yet Robust http://tcrn.ch/lAjjQ9 by @parislemon
item.content:encoded: Kohort Is Group Management Done Simple, Yet Robust http://tcrn.ch/lAjjQ9 by @parislemon Groups are all the rage right now. Facebook is focusing on them. Google is thought to be focusing on them. GroupMe, Beluga, etc. The fact that so many companies are focusing on them shows a common belief that they're extremely important. Kohort, a new service launching today at TechCrunch Disrupt in New York, believes this as well. They just believe that everyone else has failed at them so far. One reason is that Kohort believes the grouping features for most of these services are tacked-on. With Kohort, it's the central feature. And it goes deep. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: CatchFree Wants To Become The Hub Of The ‘Freemium’ Ecosystem
item.description: CatchFree Wants To Become The Hub Of The 'Freemium' Ecosystem http://tcrn.ch/iZA3d9 by @robinwauters
item.content:encoded: CatchFree Wants To Become The Hub Of The 'Freemium' Ecosystem http://tcrn.ch/iZA3d9 by @robinwauters CatchFree is making its formal debut at Disrupt today with the unveiling of a social platform that allows people to discover and sharing the best free(mium) software and services online. The startup just raised $5.5 million in funding from top notch investors such as Index Ventures, First Round Capital, True Ventures, Polaris and 500 Startups. Combining the power of social networking with freemium, the CatchFree platform wants to make it easier for people to find and share great freemium services by linking them together, enabling each service to draw off the growth experienced by other freemium products. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Write, Photograph And Film Local News As It Breaks With Meporter
item.description: Write, Photograph And Film Local News As It Breaks With Meporter http://tcrn.ch/lnNXHx by @ripemp
item.content:encoded: Write, Photograph And Film Local News As It Breaks With Meporter http://tcrn.ch/lnNXHx by @ripemp Meporter is a location-based news app that enables you to write, photograph, and record video of your local news as it breaks, and then to share those stories with anyone who owns a mobile phone or has an Internet connection. Using the Meporter app on your iPhone or iPod Touch, you can take a picture, make, a video, or write your own story, and post it for the world to see -- all in a matter of minutes. You can post about items for sale, new styles and trends, local politics, area businesses, yard sales in progress, traffic conditions – anything that’s happening in your neck of the woods. Readers will see a user's location, can comment on stories, and check in as eyewitnesses. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Tracks Is Sort Of Like Color For Normal People
item.description: Tracks Is Sort Of Like Color For Normal People http://tcrn.ch/j95aih by @parislemon
item.content:encoded: Tracks Is Sort Of Like Color For Normal People http://tcrn.ch/j95aih by @parislemon Of all the things written about the heavily funded Color, there is no denying that it's confusing to a lot of people, at least at first. Updates have helped this a bit, but the app relies so much on technology in the background, that it almost seems as if you're doing something wrong when you're using it. Tracks, a new app launching today at TechCrunch Disrupt in New York, offers similar photo clusters done on the fly. But it's much, much easier to understand. The examples the team gives for uses range from a pub crawl with friends to a family vacation. You and the people with you (who have to be explicitly invited into a group, rather than Color's automatic method) create picture albums on the fly. These are called Tracks. And these tracks are then viewable both in the app and on the web in a beautiful, optimized experience. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: InvoiceASAP Allows You To Create And Send Invoices From Your Mobile Phone
item.description: InvoiceASAP Allows You To Create And Send Invoices From Your Mobile Phone http://tcrn.ch/jEhgX4 by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: InvoiceASAP Allows You To Create And Send Invoices From Your Mobile Phone http://tcrn.ch/jEhgX4 by @leenarao InvoiceASAP, which launched at TechCrunch Disrupt today, is a cloud-based invoice app that allows you to easily create and send professional invoices, estimates, sales orders and receipts. The app provides easy-to-use menus on your mobile phone, and swiftly guides the user through the setup and invoicing process, making your device a powerful tool for business management. InvoiceASAP is all about taking its service mobile, but offering the full suite of services a Web app would provide as well. So, the startup provides invoicing that integrates with accounting software, so that a user's invoices, estimates, sales orders and receipts can all sync with accounting. You or your sales team can add new accounts from the field that are simultaneously created in accounting as well. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Survey Finds E-Book Piracy Occurs Among a Surprising Demographic
item.description: Survey Finds E-Book Piracy Occurs Among a Surprising Demographic http://rww.to/khsNPQ
item.content:encoded: Survey Finds E-Book Piracy Occurs Among a Surprising Demographic http://rww.to/khsNPQ Digital piracy. It's an illicit activity undertaken by college students in their dorm rooms or by teenagers in their parents' basements, right? Wrong, according to a recent survey by the British law firm Wiggin. Or wrong when it comes to digital piracy at least. According to the firm's annual Digital Entertainment Survey, one in 8 women over age 35 who owns an e-reader admits to having downloaded an illegal version of an e-book. That compares to just one in 20 women in the same age group who admits to having pirated music.... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: How Do You Get Kids To Learn? Have Them Draw Butts On The iPad
item.description: How Do You Get Kids To Learn? Have Them Draw Butts On The iPad http://tcrn.ch/jmnxfs by @parislemon
item.content:encoded: How Do You Get Kids To Learn? Have Them Draw Butts On The iPad http://tcrn.ch/jmnxfs by @parislemon The pitch behind Madbrook Publishing's first product is pretty amazing. It seems like it should for sure be a joke. But it’s not. It’s Everything Butt Art. No, that’s not a typo. The product is not “Everything But Art”, it’s “Everything Butt Art” — two “t’s”. Butt. As in, the thing you sit on. That’s the basis for the product. And it's launching today at TechCrunch Disrupt in New York. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com

item.title: Oil speculators made $50 million by manipulating price: CFTC - May. 24, 2011
item.description: Look who's being charged with oil price manipulation http://bit.ly/lHxL8v #oilpriceshenanigans
item.content:encoded: Look who's being charged with oil price manipulation http://bit.ly/lHxL8v #oilpriceshenanigans Federal regulators charged five oil speculators Tuesday with manipulating the price of crude in 2008 and profiting $50 million from the scheme. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: cnn.com

item.content:encoded: Why do porn sites have lower PageRank? http://goo.gl/P4riC What are the technical reasons porn sites have such low PageRank? None go over PR6. A lack of links from trusted sites? Rampant link exchanges with low quali... Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Foretuit Tracks And Maps Sales Operations For Organizations
item.description: Foretuit Tracks And Maps Sales Operations For Organizations http://tcrn.ch/kU9F5v by @leenarao
item.content:encoded: Foretuit Tracks And Maps Sales Operations For Organizations http://tcrn.ch/kU9F5v by @leenarao Tracking the success and productivity for sales reps can be a challenge for any organization. Foretuit, which launches today at TechCrunch Disrupt, maps sales employees’ business behavior and determines patterns in order to provide predictive outcomes for sales operations. Foretuit says that the sales process is inefficient because of compliance (sales reps don't actually put data in CRM applications) and reps don't leep data current. Fortuit's application for the Salesforce CRM helps solve this problem. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: techcrunch.com
